page.title: 16WANDLEBURY: PUBLIC, ANIMALS
page.content: Over 70,000 people visited Wandlebury in 1984. Most came at weekends, arriving mainly by car. Most showed respect for the countryside. Problems resulting from the large number of visitors include: areas trampled bare, flowers picked, plants uprooted, wildlife disturbed, vandalism from 1-2% of the visitors. The money needed to run Wandlebury comes from the Cambridge Preservation Society, donations from the public and grants from Cambridgeshire County Council. The most common animals in the area are rabbits and grey squirrels. Other animals include:foxes, moles, short-tailed voles, long-tailed voles, common shrews, pygmy shrews, yellow- necked mice, woodmice, rats, weasels, hedgehogs, muntjac deer, hares, feral cats, lizards, frogs, toads, newts.
